stories.headline: Tracking the trends
stories.summary: Naomi Aoki discusses efforts by The Virginian-Pilot to provide readers with a more accurate picture of crime trends in the South Hampton Roads region through regular reporting on crime trends using computer-assisted reporting.

stories.headline: Score! CAR assists sports writers
stories.summary: Stan Dorsey explores the potential of computer-assisted reporting in sports journalism, highlighting how reporters like Tom Witosky use data analysis tools to provide deeper insights into sports statistics and trends.

stories.headline: The real story Project misconceptions
stories.summary: Matthew Waite investigates and dispels misconceptions about the Malone neighborhood in Lincoln using computerized data analysis, revealing it as a safe and ethnically diverse area, rather than the crime-ridden ghetto it was thought to be.

stories.headline: Trading places Voters shift to third parties
stories.summary: Bill Thompson and Kristina Schurr analyze voter registration data in Maryland, finding significant shifts towards third-party registration and voting, particularly in rural areas, indicating a growing disenchantment with traditional political parties.

stories.headline: Babies, buildings and bureaucrats
stories.summary: Natalya Shulyakovskaya reflects on her experiences with computer-assisted reporting at the St. Louis Post-Dispatch, detailing various investigative projects that ranged from analyzing birth records to scrutinizing city expenditures on demolitions.
